channel.title: consumer electronics on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in consumer electronics on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Aiwa Logo
Aiwa is a consumer electronics brand owned and used by various companies in different regions of the world. American and other regions are owned by Chicago-based Aiwa Corporation. Towada Audio based in Tokyo owns rights in Japan and elsewhere and has been manufacturing Aiwa-branded products since 2017. In Mexico and other countries in Latin America, rights are owned by Audio Mobile Americas, S.A. Aiwa was founded in 1951 and was once a globally well-regarded brand known for making quality audio products such as speakers, boomboxes and stereo systems.
You can download theAiwalogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Aiwa
item.description: Aiwa is a consumer electronics brand owned and used by various companies in different regions of the world. American and other regions are owned by Chicago-based Aiwa Corporation. Towada Audio based in Tokyo owns rights in Japan and elsewhere and has been manufacturing Aiwa-branded products since 2017. In Mexico and other countries in Latin America, rights are owned by Audio Mobile Americas, S.A. Aiwa was founded in 1951 and was once a globally well-regarded brand known for making quality audio products such as speakers, boomboxes and stereo systems.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Gigabyte Technology Logo
Gigabyte Technology is a Taiwanese manufacturer and distributor of computer hardware. Gigabyte’s principal business is motherboards. It shipped 4.8 million motherboards in the first quarter of 2015, which allowed it to become the leading motherboard vendor. Gigabyte also manufactures custom graphics cards and laptop computers. In 2010, Gigabyte was ranked 17th in “Taiwan’s Top 20 Global Brands” by the Taiwan External Trade Development Council. The company is publicly held and traded on the Taiwan Stock Exchange, stock ID number TWSE: 2376.
You can download theGigabytelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Gigabyte
item.description: Gigabyte Technology is a Taiwanese manufacturer and distributor of computer hardware. Gigabyte’s principal business is motherboards. It shipped 4.8 million motherboards in the first quarter of 2015, which allowed it to become the leading motherboard vendor. Gigabyte also manufactures custom graphics cards and laptop computers. In 2010, Gigabyte was ranked 17th in “Taiwan’s Top 20 Global Brands” by the Taiwan External Trade Development Council. The company is publicly held and traded on the Taiwan Stock Exchange, stock ID number TWSE: 2376.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Grundig Logo
Grundig is a German consumer electronics manufacturer owned by Arçelik A.Ş., the white goods manufacturer of Turkish conglomerate Koç Holding. The company made domestic appliances and personal care products. Originally a German consumer electronic company, Grundig GmbH was founded in 1945 by Max Grundig and eventually headquartered in Nuremberg. It grew to become one of the leading radio, TV, recorder and other electronics goods manufacturers of Europe in the following decades of the 20 century.
You can download theGrundiglogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Grundig
item.description: Grundig is a German consumer electronics manufacturer owned by Arçelik A.Ş., the white goods manufacturer of Turkish conglomerate Koç Holding. The company made domestic appliances and personal care products. Originally a German consumer electronic company, Grundig GmbH was founded in 1945 by Max Grundig and eventually headquartered in Nuremberg. It grew to become one of the leading radio, TV, recorder and other electronics goods manufacturers of Europe in the following decades of the 20 century.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Pegatron Logo Pegatron Corporation is a Taiwanese electronics manufacturing company that mainly develops computing, communications and consumer electronics for branded vendors. It also develops, designs and manufactures computer peripherals and components. Pegatron’s primary products include notebooks, netbook computers, desktop computers, game consoles, handheld devices, motherboards, video cards and LCD TVs, as well as broadband communication products such as smartphones, set-top boxes and cable modems. Source
You can download thePegatronlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Pegatron
item.description: Pegatron Corporation is a Taiwanese electronics manufacturing company that mainly develops computing, communications and consumer electronics for branded vendors. It also develops, designs and manufactures computer peripherals and components. Pegatron’s primary products include notebooks, netbook computers, desktop computers, game consoles, handheld devices, motherboards, video cards and LCD TVs, as well as broadband communication products such as smartphones, set-top boxes and cable modems. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 HMD Global Logo
HMD Global Oyj, branded as HMD and Nokia Mobile, is a Finnish mobile phone manufacturer. The company is made up of the mobile phone business that Nokia sold to Microsoft in 2014, then bought back in 2016. HMD began marketing Nokia-branded smartphones and feature phones on 1 December 2016. The company has exclusive rights to the Nokia brand for mobile phones through a licensing agreement. The HMD brand is only used for corporate purposes and does not appear in advertising, whereas the name “Nokia Mobile” is used on social media.
You can download theHMDlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: HMD
item.description: HMD Global Oyj, branded as HMD and Nokia Mobile, is a Finnish mobile phone manufacturer. The company is made up of the mobile phone business that Nokia sold to Microsoft in 2014, then bought back in 2016. HMD began marketing Nokia-branded smartphones and feature phones on 1 December 2016. The company has exclusive rights to the Nokia brand for mobile phones through a licensing agreement. The HMD brand is only used for corporate purposes and does not appear in advertising, whereas the name “Nokia Mobile” is used on social media.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Media Markt Logo Media Markt is a German multinational chain of stores selling consumer electronics with numerous branches throughout Europe. It is Europe’s largest retailer of consumer electronics, and the second largest in the world after American retailer Best Buy. Source
You can download theMedia Marktlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Media Markt
item.description: Media Markt is a German multinational chain of stores selling consumer electronics with numerous branches throughout Europe. It is Europe’s largest retailer of consumer electronics, and the second largest in the world after American retailer Best Buy. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
OnePlus Logo
OnePlus Technology Co., Ltd. is a Chinese consumer electronics manufacturer headquartered in Shenzhen, Guangdong province, in the Tairan Building at the Chegong Temple subdistrict of Futian District. It was founded by Pete Lau and Carl Pei in December 2013, and is currently majority-owned by Oppo as its only shareholder, which is a subsidiary of BBK Electronics along with Vivo, Realme and iQOO. The company is best known for making smartphones, and officially serves 34 countries and regions around the world as of July 2018.
You can download theOnePluslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: OnePlus
item.description: OnePlus Technology Co., Ltd. is a Chinese consumer electronics manufacturer headquartered in Shenzhen, Guangdong province, in the Tairan Building at the Chegong Temple subdistrict of Futian District. It was founded by Pete Lau and Carl Pei in December 2013, and is currently majority-owned by Oppo as its only shareholder, which is a subsidiary of BBK Electronics along with Vivo, Realme and iQOO. The company is best known for making smartphones, and officially serves 34 countries and regions around the world as of July 2018.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Xiaomi Logo
Xiaomi Corporation, registered in Asia as Xiaomi Inc., is a Chinese multinational electronics company founded in April 2010 and headquartered in Beijing. Xiaomi makes and invests in smartphones, mobile apps, laptops, home appliances, bags, shoes, consumer electronics, and many other products. Xiaomi released its first smartphone in August 2011 and rapidly gained market share in China to become the country’s largest smartphone company in 2014. At the start of second quarter of 2018, Xiaomi was the world’s fourth-largest smartphone manufacturer, leading in both the largest market, China, and the second-largest market, India.
You can download theXiaomilogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Xiaomi
item.description: Xiaomi Corporation, registered in Asia as Xiaomi Inc., is a Chinese multinational electronics company founded in April 2010 and headquartered in Beijing. Xiaomi makes and invests in smartphones, mobile apps, laptops, home appliances, bags, shoes, consumer electronics, and many other products. Xiaomi released its first smartphone in August 2011 and rapidly gained market share in China to become the country’s largest smartphone company in 2014. At the start of second quarter of 2018, Xiaomi was the world’s fourth-largest smartphone manufacturer, leading in both the largest market, China, and the second-largest market, India.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Abt Electronics Logo Abt Electronics is an independent retailer in the United States of consumer electronics, major appliances, and furniture. Abt operates at a single location in Glenview, Illinois, on 70 acres of land, and through an online retail website. The store is a family-owned business that has operated in the Chicago market since 1936. Source
You can download theAbt Electronicslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Abt Electronics
item.description: Abt Electronics is an independent retailer in the United States of consumer electronics, major appliances, and furniture. Abt operates at a single location in Glenview, Illinois, on 70 acres of land, and through an online retail website. The store is a family-owned business that has operated in the Chicago market since 1936. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
CompUSA Logo
CompUSA was a retailer and reseller of personal computers, consumer electronics, technology products and computer services. Starting with one brick-and-mortar store in 1986 under the name Soft Warehouse, by the 1990s CompUSA had grown into a nationwide big box chain. At its peak, it operated at least 229 locations. Crushed by competition from other brick-and-mortar retailers, corporate oversight which was out of touch with evolving market realities, and a failure to make a strong transition to online sales, CompUSA began closing what they classified as “low performing” locations in 2006.
You can download theCompUSAlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: CompUSA
item.description: CompUSA was a retailer and reseller of personal computers, consumer electronics, technology products and computer services. Starting with one brick-and-mortar store in 1986 under the name Soft Warehouse, by the 1990s CompUSA had grown into a nationwide big box chain. At its peak, it operated at least 229 locations. Crushed by competition from other brick-and-mortar retailers, corporate oversight which was out of touch with evolving market realities, and a failure to make a strong transition to online sales, CompUSA began closing what they classified as “low performing” locations in 2006.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Elgiganten Logo Elgiganten is a consumer electronics retailer operating in Denmark and Sweden, where its parent Elkjøp operates in Norway and have subsidiaries like Gigantti, Elko and Elding. There are Elgiganten A/S and Elgiganten AB both directly operated under Elkjøp Nordic AS. Source
You can download theElgigantenlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.description: Elgiganten is a consumer electronics retailer operating in Denmark and Sweden, where its parent Elkjøp operates in Norway and have subsidiaries like Gigantti, Elko and Elding. There are Elgiganten A/S and Elgiganten AB both directly operated under Elkjøp Nordic AS. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 The Source Logo
The Source Electronics Inc., doing business as The Source, is a Canadian consumer electronics and cell phone retail chain. The chain goes back over 40 years in Canada, initially as Radio Shack and later as The Source by Circuit City. The Source is now owned by BCE Inc., which purchased the assets of InterTAN from its parent, American retailer Circuit City, in 2009. The Source is a unit of 4458729 Canada Inc.
You can download theSourcelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Source
item.description: The Source Electronics Inc., doing business as The Source, is a Canadian consumer electronics and cell phone retail chain. The chain goes back over 40 years in Canada, initially as Radio Shack and later as The Source by Circuit City. The Source is now owned by BCE Inc., which purchased the assets of InterTAN from its parent, American retailer Circuit City, in 2009. The Source is a unit of 4458729 Canada Inc.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Fry's Electronics Logo
Fry’s Electronics was an American big-box store chain headquartered in Silicon Valley. Fry’s retailed software, consumer electronics, household appliances, cosmetics, tools, toys, accessories, magazines, technical books, and computer hardware. Fry’s had in-store computer repair and custom computer building services. Fry’s began with one store in Sunnyvale, California, which expanded to 34 stores in nine states at its peak in 2019. On February 24, 2021, Fry’s announced the immediate and permanent closure of all of its stores due to the chain ceasing operations.
You can download theFryslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Frys
item.description: Fry’s Electronics was an American big-box store chain headquartered in Silicon Valley. Fry’s retailed software, consumer electronics, household appliances, cosmetics, tools, toys, accessories, magazines, technical books, and computer hardware. Fry’s had in-store computer repair and custom computer building services. Fry’s began with one store in Sunnyvale, California, which expanded to 34 stores in nine states at its peak in 2019. On February 24, 2021, Fry’s announced the immediate and permanent closure of all of its stores due to the chain ceasing operations.
